name: Dhy1102763826.GitHub.com
body:
Hello,everyone!Welcome to my github!Welcome to my silly life!
# Name :Hengyu Du
## Student of Dalian University Of Technique
## E-mail:1102763826@qq.com
## Phone:18742011149
### ANNOUNCEMENT	 Welcome!
### WHAT'S NEW	[paper] Our paper "Error Tolerant Dual-Hydrophone Localization in Underwater Sensor Networks" is accepted by IEEE/MTS OCEANS 2016.
### [paper] Our paper "DiVA: Distributed Voronoi-based Acoustic Source Localization with Wireless Sensor Networks" is accepted by IEEE INFOCOM 2016.
### [paper] Our paper "A Novel Dual-Hydrophone Localization Method in Underwater Sensor Networks" is accepted by IEEE/OES China Ocean Acoustics Symposium (COA2016).
### [paper] Our paper "Acoustic Source Localization with Distributed Smartphone Arrays" is accepted by GLOBLECOM'16.
### SHORT BIOGRAPHY	Dr. Naigao Jin is an Assistant Professor with School of Software at Dalian University of Technology (DUT). 
### A visiting scholar hosted by Prof. Tian He at UMN from Jan. 2012 to Jan. 2013. He received his Ph.D. degree in Signal Processing from Dalian University of Technology in 2008. Naigao obtained B.E. and M.E. degrees from Dalian Jiaotong University and DUT in 1999 and 2002, respectively. Naigao is currently a member of IEEE Computer Society.
### RESEARCH INTERESTS	I enjoy building embedded systems and have a strong passion for wireless sensor networking, audio signal processing. Currently, my research theme is smartphone computing including but not limited to the following topics: 
### ➤ Time synchronization, localization and tracking in wireless sensor networks.
### ➤ Indoor localization based on Smartphone
### ➤ Localization in underwater sensor network.
### REPRESENTATIVE PUBLICATIONS	
### IEEE INFOCOM'16 : Xueshu Zheng, Shuailing Yang, Naigao Jin*, Lei Wang, Mathew L. Wymore, Daji Qiao: Diva: Distributed Voronoi-based Acoustic Source Localization with Wireless Sensor Networks. INFOCOM 2016. PDF.
### IEEE ICC'15: Sanfeng Zhu, Naigao Jin, Xueshu Zheng, Han Yao, Shuailing Yang, Lei Wang: A probability-based acoustic source localization scheme using dual-microphone smartphones. ICC 2015. PDF.
### IEEE MASS'13: Naigao Jin, Ziguo Zhong, Tian He: Optimizing Event-Driven Localization. MASS 2013. PDF
